process.name: wrapper
process.narrative: wrapper for the Blue Prism internal business objects for consumption by external systems

stage.name: Clean Up
stage.narrative: unused

stage.name: get_next_item
stage.narrative: get next item from queue

stage.name: Note1
stage.narrative:
Clean Up Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some finalisation (or "cleanup") tasks as your business object is closed down.
The cleanup action will be called automatically immediately after closing your business object at the end of a business process.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than before the disposal of the business object.

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative:
Initialise Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some initialisation tasks after your business object is loaded.
The initialise action will be called automatically immediately after loading your business object.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than after the creation of the object.

stage.name: Get item data
stage.narrative: Get data relating to an item in a queue. You do not need to have a lock on the item to do this.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to get data from. An error will be raised if this item does not exist.

output.name: Key
output.narrative: The key value of the item.

output.name: Priority
output.narrative: The priority of the item

output.name: Status
output.narrative: The status of the item.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

output.name: Worktime
output.narrative: The total time spent on this item (including previous attempts)

output.name: Attempt Worktime
output.narrative: The amount of time spent on this particular attempt of the item

output.name: Loaded DateTime
output.narrative: The date and time at which this item was first loaded into the queue.

output.name: Deferred DateTime
output.narrative: The date and time at which this item has been deferred to. Empty if this item has not been deferred.

output.name: Completed DateTime
output.narrative: The date and time at which this item was marked as complete. Empty if this item has not been marked as complete

output.name: Exception DateTime
output.narrative: The date and time at which this item was marked as an exception. Empty if there has never been an exception on this item.

output.name: Exception Reason
output.narrative: The exception reason recorded against this item.

output.name: Tags
output.narrative: The semi-colon separated set of tags which apply to the item.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

stage.name: mark_as_complete
stage.narrative: mark item as complete

stage.name: mark as complete
stage.narrative: Marks the item as completed, by updating the Completed timestamp and setting Locked to null. The item must be 'owned' by the calling process - i.e. it must have been retrieved using Get Next Item.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

stage.name: mark_as_exception
stage.narrative: mark item as exception

stage.name: mark as exception
stage.narrative: Marks the item as an exception, optionally retrying it by cloning the item and returning the ID of the clone. The item must be 'owned' by the calling process - i.e. it must have been retrieved using Get Next Item.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Exception Reason
input.narrative: A description of the reason for the exception

input.name: Retry
input.narrative: Whether or not to retry the item, up to the maximum number of attempts specified for the queue. Optional - if not specified, the item will be retried

input.name: Keep Locked
input.narrative: Whether or not the clone of the item should remain locked after the exception has been registered and the item is retried. Optional - default is False

output.name: New Item ID
output.narrative: The Item ID of the newly cloned item. This item will be locked if 'Keep Locked' is True. This will be empty if no item was cloned (ie. the item was not retried.

stage.name: add_to_queue
stage.narrative:
Given a collection of items, adds only the ones that are not already present in the queue.
Tag Item with the Item ID

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: Name of queue to add items to.

input.name: Queue Items
input.narrative: Collection of items to add.

input.name: Key Name
input.narrative: Name of column that stores item key.

input.name: Include Pending
input.narrative: If true, includes pending items in search. Defaults to true.

input.name: Include Deferred
input.narrative: If true, includes deferred items in search. Defaults to true.

input.name: Include Completed
input.narrative: If true, includes completed items in search. Defaults to true.

input.name: Include Terminated
input.narrative: If true, includes terminated items in search. Defaults to true.

input.name: Status
input.narrative: Status of added items.

output.name: Item IDs
output.narrative: IDs of all items that were added.

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

input.name: Collection
input.narrative: The target collection.

input.name: Row Number
input.narrative: The row number to retrieve, starting from zero.

output.name: Row
output.narrative: The retrieved row.

stage.name: Check if Item Exists
stage.narrative: Check if an item with the given key is already in the queue

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to check

input.name: Key
input.narrative: The key to check.

input.name: Include Pending
input.narrative: Check any items in the queue which are currently awaiting being worked. This will include any deferred items which have a deferral date in the past and any locked items. Optional - Default is True

input.name: Include Deferred
input.narrative: Check any items in the queue which are currently deferred to a later date. Optional - Default is True

input.name: Include Completed
input.narrative: Check any items in the queue which are completed. Optional - Default is True

input.name: Include Terminated
input.narrative: Check any items in the queue which have been fully terminated. Optional - Default is True

output.name: Item IDs
output.narrative: The Item IDs which represent the work items found with the given key

output.name: Result
output.narrative: True if an item with the given key is in the queue, False otherwise.

input.name: Collection
input.narrative: The collection to read.

input.name: Field Name
input.narrative: The field within the collection to read.

input.name: Row Index
input.narrative: The row index within the collection to read from. The index is from 0 to N-1 (where N is the total number of rows in the collection).

output.name: Value Read
output.narrative: The value of the requested field as text.

stage.name: Add Row to Queue
stage.narrative:
The Data collection contains the items to be added to the queue. The collection may contain single or multiple rows, with each representing an item to be added.
If there is a failure during the process, the queue will be unchanged - i.e. no rows will be loaded even if the error occurred on the last one.
If Defer Until is specified, the items will not be available to be worked until then. Otherwise, they are available immediately.
If the queue has a key field defined, an item added has key data longer than the maximum permitted 255 characters, an error will occur

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Data
input.narrative: A collection containing the data, one row for each item to be added

input.name: Defer Until
input.narrative: Optionally, the date/time the new item(s) should be deferred until

input.name: Priority
input.narrative: Optionally, the priority for the new item(s). Lower numbers represent higher priorities. The default is 0.

input.name: Tags
input.narrative: Optionally, a semi-colon-separated set of tags to apply to the queue item(s)

input.name: Status
input.narrative: Optionally, the initial status required of the work queue item(s)

output.name: Item IDs
output.narrative: The IDs of the items which have been added to the queue, in the order of the collection of data passed that was input

output.name: Item IDs
output.narrative: IDs of all items that were added.

stage.name: Add New Row to Item IDs

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

stage.name: Tag Item
stage.narrative: Adds a tag to a work queue item

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the queue item to add the tag to

input.name: Tag
input.narrative: The tag to add to the item. Note that this cannot start with a '+' (plus) or '-' (minus) character, and cannot contain ';' (semi-colon) characters

field.name: Item ID
field.description: The Item ID of the work queue item

stage.name: Get next item
stage.narrative: Retrieves the IDs for all currently pending work queue items in the specified queue, matching the given tags

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue for which the pending items are required

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

input.name: Maximum
input.narrative: Optionally, the maximum number of items to return. Default is to return all items

input.name: Skip
input.narrative: Optionally, the number of items to skip before returning. Default is zero, ie. return all items from the head of the queue

output.name: Pending Items
output.narrative: The currently pending items in the queue, referenced by ID. The single column is 'Item ID' : text. The elements in the collection will be in the order in which they will be loaded by the 'Get Next Item' action.

stage.name: Lock Item
stage.narrative:
This action gets the next item to be worked from the queue, returning its details and locking it so no other case can work it.
Items with higher priorities (lower numerical value) are processed first. Where the priority is the same, the next item is the one that has been in the queue the longest, is not already locked, and is not already completed.
The Item ID returned is used to make further calls to update the work status for that item. It may be empty, in which case there are no items available. This can mean either a) the queue is empty, or b) the queue is not running. This mechanism can be used to cleanly stop all processes working a particular queue at the end of the next case. Items that have a 'deferred' time set will not be returned unless that time has been reached.

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

output.name: Item ID
output.narrative: The ID of the item retrieved - empty if there are none available.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

output.name: Status
output.narrative: The status of the item.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

stage.name: Lock Item
stage.narrative:
This action gets the next item to be worked from the queue, returning its details and locking it so no other case can work it.
Items with higher priorities (lower numerical value) are processed first. Where the priority is the same, the next item is the one that has been in the queue the longest, is not already locked, and is not already completed.
The Item ID returned is used to make further calls to update the work status for that item. It may be empty, in which case there are no items available. This can mean either a) the queue is empty, or b) the queue is not running. This mechanism can be used to cleanly stop all processes working a particular queue at the end of the next case. Items that have a 'deferred' time set will not be returned unless that time has been reached.

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

output.name: Item ID
output.narrative: The ID of the item retrieved - empty if there are none available.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

output.name: Status
output.narrative: The status of the item.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

stage.name: get_credential
stage.narrative: Get username and password from the credential name

stage.name: get_credential
stage.narrative:
Get the specified set of credentials.
An Exception will occur if access to the credentials is not allowed, based on the running Resource, Process and User.

input.name: Credentials Name
input.narrative: The name of the credentials to get

output.name: Password
output.narrative: The password

output.name: Username
output.narrative: The user name

output.name: Expiry Date
output.narrative: The expiry date

output.name: Status
output.narrative: The status

stage.name: Update Status
stage.narrative:
Updates the status field for the item. The status field can be used to flag what has been done in a process so far. If a process encounters an exception, this information can be used to skip to the parts of the process not yet done for the item next time it is worked. The item must be 'owned' by the calling process - i.e. it must have been retrieved using Get Next Item.
This action will also reset the Attempts column to zero, because if the status updated the process should have successfully done something.

input.name: Status
input.narrative: The new status - 255 characters maximum.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

stage.name: Tag Item
stage.narrative: Adds a tag to a work queue item

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the queue item to add the tag to

input.name: Tag
input.narrative: The tag to add to the item. Note that this cannot start with a '+' (plus) or '-' (minus) character, and cannot contain ';' (semi-colon) characters

stage.name: Update Status
stage.narrative:
Updates the status field for the item. The status field can be used to flag what has been done in a process so far. If a process encounters an exception, this information can be used to skip to the parts of the process not yet done for the item next time it is worked. The item must be 'owned' by the calling process - i.e. it must have been retrieved using Get Next Item.
This action will also reset the Attempts column to zero, because if the status updated the process should have successfully done something.

input.name: Status
input.narrative: The new status - 255 characters maximum.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

stage.name: Untag Item
stage.narrative: Removes a tag from a work queue item

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the queue item to remove the tag from

input.name: Tag
input.narrative: The tag to remove from the item. Note that this cannot start with a '+' (plus) or '-' (minus) character, and cannot contain ';' (semi-colon) characters

stage.narrative: Removes a tag from a work queue item

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the queue item to remove the tag from

input.name: Tag
input.narrative: The tag to remove from the item. Note that this cannot start with a '+' (plus) or '-' (minus) character, and cannot contain ';' (semi-colon) characters
